main event: A bright flash of light was observed followed by an explosion near Kalispell, Montana on January 9, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, high-speed object that exploded.
The observation was made by a civilian witness.
The sighting lasted for a brief, unspecified duration.
The object was moving in a straight course.
The report concluded that the sighting was likely a meteorite, as no one was known to be in the area.
